alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued July 30 at 2:13AM PDT until August 03 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT FOR THUNDERSTORMS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM PDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS WEEKEND... * WHAT...Thunderstorms possible today and Sunday. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas and Orange County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...Thunderstorms through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Dangerous cloud to ground lightning from any thunderstorms. ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM PDT THIS MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Elevated surf of 4 to 6 feet with sets to 7 feet developing Sunday night and continuing through Wednesday. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas and Orange County Coastal Areas. Highest surf across south and southwest facing beaches. * WHEN...From 8 AM PDT today through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Elevated surf and strong rip currents will create dangerous swimming conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surf will increase Sunday night, peak on Monday and Tuesday, and diminish on Wednesday. High risk of strong rip currents. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions. A beach hazards statement is issued when threats such as strong rip currents...elevated surf heights...minor tidal overflow...or lightning are possible at local beaches. Obey posted warning signs and flags and talk to a lifeguard before swimming. Use caution when in or near the water and always swim near a lifeguard.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
